author: Shinee
tags: beef, potatoes, hash, skillet, quick-meal, comfort-food
storage: Refrigerate leftover hash in airtight container for up to 3 days. Can also be frozen for up to 3 months.

allIngredients.description: diced (any variety - russet, Yukon gold, red, or purple)

prelude.description: This ground beef and potatoes hash is a quick and easy 30-minute meal that's full of flavor. As a family favorite recipe, it uses just a single skillet to make clean-up simple. Hamburger hash has never been so comforting or delicious.

images.description: Ground beef potato hash with an egg in a grey bowl

steps.description: Brown the ground beef with seasonings in a skillet over medium high heat. Break down the meat into fine pieces as you don't want any chunks. Cook until the beef is no longer red.
Transfer the cooked beef to a clean plate or bowl.
Add diced potatoes into the now empty skillet and cook for about 4 minutes. Don't stir the potatoes too much as you want to develop a nice golden-brown crust.
Add the ground beef back into the skillet, then add broth or water. Cook until the potatoes are cooked through, about 8 minutes.
Optional: Add eggs by making wells in the mixture depending on how many eggs you wish to add. Add the eggs into the wells, cover with a lid and cook the eggs to your liking.
